text: Wang Shouguan (; 15 January 1923 â€“ 28 January 2021) was a Chinese astronomer. He was President of the . He was known as one of the founders of modern astrophysics and radio astronomy in China. He was a delegate to the National People's Congress from 1977 to 1994. In 1980, he became a member of the Chinese Academy of Sciences. Wang was born in Fuzhou, China. Wang died on 28 January 2021 in Beijing, aged 98. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Chinese politicians Category:Chinese astronomers Category:20th-century Chinese scientists
title: Wang Shouguan
